head.title: Bethlehem Steel Unit Is Being Sold

hedline.hl1: Bethlehem Steel Unit Is Being Sold

block.p: TMB Industries, an investment company, said it and the Onex Corporation iin Toronto had agreed to buy the Bethlehem Steel Corporation's freight-car unit for an undisclosed price. The operation, based in Johnstown, Pa., makes all types of freight cars except tank cars. Its sales totaled about $200 million last year.

Bethlehem said the sale was in line with its plan to divest itself of its non-steel businesses. It said the sale included the unit's car-building shops and plants. TMB was founded by Thomas M. Begel, the former chairman and chief executive of the Pullman Company, and Onex, a Canadian concern with $2 billion in revenues.
